intro: Gnaphalium aphelexioides, commonly known as the common cudweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is a low-growing herb characterized by its slender stems and small, pale yellow to white composite flowers. The plant typically has finely divided, linear leaves that are covered in fine hairs. It is native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and disturbed soils. Gnaphalium aphelexioides is known for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and its role in supporting pollinators.
